content.instruction: Click on the 'hot spots' to view additional information.

activity.text:
Political cartoonists:
  • expose hypocrisy.
  • point out pretentiousness.
  • laugh at arrogance.
  • deflate the powerful.
  • give voice to the underdog.

hotspots.hotspot:
hypocrisy

Criticizing an action or belief while at the same time doing that action or holding that belief

pretentiousness

Exaggerating one's own importance, worth, and skills through words or actions

underdog

Someone who is bullied or treated unjustly

scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.
(bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (others) Comstock/Getty Images.

(tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (c)MIKE PETERS EDTCTN (NEW) © KING FEATURES SYNDICATE, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.

multiple.question: What is the point of this cartoon?

answers.answer: Educated people sometimes miss seeing the obvious.
The Founding Fathers neglected women's rights.
Women should receive equal pay for equal work.

scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (inset)MIKE PETERS EDTCTN (NEW) © KING FEATURES SYNDICATE, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.
(tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.
(tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (c)Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division [LC-DIG-ppmsc-07960], (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: A. Industrial and agricultural workers symbolized by hammer and sickle
B. Coffin labeled "communism" because Soviet communism "died" in 1991
C. Vladimir Lenin followed Marx and created Soviet Union
D. Dictator Joseph Stalin gestures and can't believe what he's seeing
E. Mikhail Gorbachev leads funeral, was Soviet president when communism "died"
F. "God" of communism, Karl Marx wrote Communist Manifesto
G. "Communist Paradise" has only three people

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

multiple.question: What metaphor has the cartoonist introduced?

answers.answer: President Theodore Roosevelt as a tough negotiator
U.S. diplomacy as a police nightstick
U.S. Capitol as a police headquarters

scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (inset)Everett Collection, Inc./Alamy, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.

multiple.question: How do you suppose Europeans in the early 1900s stereotyped Americans when they viewed the cartoon?

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: B. payment for political favors and loopholes in the budget process
D. with a single piece of paper and notebook
E. money flowing in and out of the national capital
G. no secret funds or loopholes

drops.drop: 1. What does the far left figure represent?
2. What does the far right figure represent?
3. What does the phrase "Everything's on the table" mean?
4. What does "D.C. Revolving Door" refer to?
5. What are the two figures doing?
6. How are the figures "prepared" to discuss a serious issue?

7. What do the bags of money underneath the negotiating
     table symbolize?

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'
scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.

multiple.question: What point is the cartoonist making about solutions regarding the debt crisis?

answers.answer: Both political parties are willing to make tough decisions to solve the debt crisis.
Both political parties are unwilling to make tough decisions to solve the debt crisis.
Special interest groups are willing to loan money to the government to solve the debt crisis.
The debt crisis is easy to solve because of the hidden oil wealth the United States possesses underground.
The two-party system is the best option the United States has to solve the budget crisis.

scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (inset)Used with the permission of Joel Pett and the Cartoonist Group. All rights reserved., (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.

scene.instruction: Click TRUE if the statement is true. Click FALSE if the statement is false.

multiple.question: "Hypocrisy" is criticizing an action while at the same time doing that action.
Comparing a successful nation to a jeweled crown is an example of metaphor.
Showing a politician with big ears in a political cartoon is an example of symbolism.
The symbol for the Republican Party is the donkey.
An example of irony is when a politician is found guilty of breaking a law that he himself proposed.
The goal of satire is to expose human folly to make room for improvement.
The Democratic Party is represented by the color red.
Political cartoons reflect important issues of the day.
Stereotypes may lead to dehumanizing groups of people.
"All senior citizens like to golf" is an example of caricature.

scene.credits: (tr) Comstock/Getty Images, (bkgd) Martin Ruegner/Digital Vision/Getty Images.
